title: C04-1103

sentences.text: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications .

In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented .
Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process .
We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs .
Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Entity-the_proposed_method.label: the proposed methods
Entity-the_proposed_method.description: The proposed methods refer to the novel framework and the joint source-channel transliteration model (n-gram TM) developed for machine transliteration and back-transliteration between different languages, specifically evaluated through experiments involving English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs.

Entity-n-gram_tm.label: n-gram TM
Entity-n-gram_tm.description: The n-gram TM, or n-gram transliteration model, is a joint source-channel model proposed for machine transliteration that facilitates direct orthographical mapping between different languages.

Entity-the_proposed_method_(1).label: the proposed method
Entity-the_proposed_method_(1).description: The proposed method refers to a joint source-channel transliteration model, also known as the n-gram transliteration model, which facilitates direct orthographical mapping between different languages and enhances transliteration accuracy while minimizing system development efforts.

Entity-a_novel_framework_for_machine_tra.label: a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration
aliases: a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration
Entity-a_novel_framework_for_machine_tra.description: A novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration is a proposed system that facilitates direct orthographical mapping between different languages, enhancing the transliteration process through a joint source-channel model.

mentions.local_name: a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel framework for machine transliteration and back-transliteration that enables direct orthographical mapping between different languages.

Entity-two_different_language.label: two different languages
Entity-two_different_language.description: The term 'two different languages' refers to distinct linguistic systems that are the subject of a novel framework for machine transliteration/back-transliteration, specifically in the context of enabling direct orthographical mapping between languages such as English and Chinese or English and Japanese.

Entity-direct_orthographical_mapping.label: direct orthographical mapping
Entity-direct_orthographical_mapping.description: Direct orthographical mapping (DOM) refers to a linguistic technique within a novel framework for machine transliteration/back-transliteration that facilitates the direct conversion of written forms between two different languages.

Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.label: transliteration/backtransliteration experiments
Entity-transliterationbacktransliteratio.description: The 'transliteration/backtransliteration experiments' refer to the evaluations conducted to assess the effectiveness of a novel machine transliteration framework applied to English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs.

Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.label: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration
Entity-machine_transliterationback-trans.description: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration refers to the automated process of converting text from one writing system to another and then reverting it back to the original writing system, often used in multilingual language processing applications.

Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.label: joint source-channel transliteration model
Entity-joint_source-channel_transliterat.description: A joint source-channel transliteration model is a computational framework that integrates both source language information and channel characteristics to improve the accuracy of transliterating words from one language to another.

Entity-framework.label: framework
Entity-framework.description: The framework refers to a novel system designed for machine transliteration and back-transliteration that facilitates direct orthographical mapping between different languages.

Entity-orthographical_mapping.label: orthographical mapping
Entity-orthographical_mapping.description: Orthographical mapping refers to the process of directly mapping the written forms of words between two different languages, facilitating machine transliteration and back-transliteration.

Entity-n-gram_transliteration_model.label: n-gram transliteration model
Entity-n-gram_transliteration_model.description: An n-gram transliteration model is a statistical approach used in natural language processing to convert text from one script to another by analyzing sequences of n characters or words.

Entity-study.label: study
Entity-study.description: The study refers to the evaluation of a novel framework for machine transliteration/back-transliteration, which demonstrates improvements in transliteration accuracy and reduces system development efforts.

Entity-language.label: languages
Entity-language.description: The term 'languages' refers to the distinct systems of communication, specifically English, Chinese, and Japanese, that are involved in the machine transliteration and back-transliteration processes discussed in the paper.

Entity-englishjapanese.label: English/Japanese
Entity-englishjapanese.description: English/Japanese refers to a language pair used in transliteration and back-transliteration experiments, specifically involving the English and Japanese languages.

Entity-englishchinese.label: English/Chinese
Entity-englishchinese.description: English/Chinese refers to the language pair involving English and Chinese, which is used in the context of machine transliteration and back-transliteration experiments.

Entity-transliteration_process.label: transliteration process
Entity-transliteration_process.description: The transliteration process is a linguistic operation that involves converting text from one writing system into another while preserving the original phonetic sounds.

Entity-transliteration_accuracy.label: transliteration accuracy
Entity-transliteration_accuracy.description: Transliteration accuracy refers to the measure of how correctly a text is converted from one writing system to another, reflecting the fidelity of the representation of the original language in the target script.

Entity-dom.label: DOM
Entity-dom.description: DOM refers to a concept or framework that facilitates direct orthographical mapping between different languages.

Entity-englishchinese_and_englishjapanes.label: English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs
Entity-englishchinese_and_englishjapanes.description: English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs refer to the combinations of the English language with Chinese and Japanese languages, respectively, used for translation or linguistic studies.

Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.label: multilingual speech and language applications
Entity-multilingual_speech_and_language_.description: Multilingual speech and language applications are software solutions designed to process, analyze, and generate spoken and written language across multiple languages, facilitating communication and understanding in diverse linguistic contexts.

Entity-system_development_effort.label: system development effort
Entity-system_development_effort.description: The term 'system development effort' refers to the resources, time, and complexity involved in creating and implementing a machine transliteration framework that enhances transliteration accuracy.

Entity-method.label: methods
Entity-method.description: Methods refer to systematic techniques or approaches used to conduct research or experiments in various fields.

summary: Machine transliteration/back-transliteration plays an important role in many multilingual speech and language applications . In this paper , a novel framework for machine transliteration/backtransliteration that allows us to carry out direct orthographical mapping -LRB- DOM -RRB- between two different languages is presented . Under this framework , a joint source-channel transliteration model , also called n-gram transliteration model -LRB- n-gram TM -RRB- , is further proposed to model the transliteration process . We evaluate the proposed methods through several transliteration/backtransliteration experiments for English/Chinese and English/Japanese language pairs . Our study reveals that the proposed method not only reduces an extensive system development effort but also improves the transliteration accuracy significantly .

Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.label: plays an important role in
Predicate-plays_an_important_role_in.description: The predicate 'plays an important role in' indicates that the subject significantly contributes to or is a crucial component of the object, highlighting the subject's relevance and impact within the context of the object. It suggests that the subject is not merely involved but is essential for the functioning, development, or success of the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or making known the object, which typically represents a concept, idea, framework, or finding. This connection implies that the subject is providing information or evidence about the object in a manner that is intended to inform or educate the audience.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates that the subject provides the capability or opportunity for the object to occur or be realized. It suggests a facilitative relationship where the subject enables, permits, or makes possible the action, process, or state represented by the object.

Predicate-is_between.label: is between
Predicate-is_between.description: The predicate 'is between' indicates a relational position or state where the subject exists in a context that connects or relates to the object, often implying a distinction or interaction that occurs within the scope defined by the subject and object. It suggests that the subject serves as a link or intermediary that facilitates a relationship or comparison involving the object.

Predicate-allows_us_to_carry_out.label: allows us to carry out
Predicate-allows_us_to_carry_out.description: The predicate 'allows us to carry out' indicates that the subject provides the means, capability, or opportunity to perform or execute the action or process described by the object. It establishes a functional relationship where the subject facilitates the realization of the object, enabling the execution of specific tasks or operations.

Predicate-is_presented.label: is presented
Predicate-is_presented.description: The predicate 'is presented' indicates that the subject is being introduced, displayed, or made known to an audience or context, with the object often representing the medium, format, or context in which the subject is being shared or showcased. This connection implies a transfer of information or knowledge from the subject to the audience through the object.

Predicate-is_proposed_to_model.label: is proposed to model
Predicate-is_proposed_to_model.description: The predicate 'is proposed to model' indicates that the subject is suggested or recommended as a framework or system to represent, simulate, or analyze the characteristics and dynamics of the object. It implies a theoretical or practical intention to use the subject as a means to understand or replicate the behavior of the object in a specific context.

Predicate-is_also_called.label: is also called
Predicate-is_also_called.description: The predicate 'is also called' indicates that the subject has an alternative name or designation represented by the object. This relationship signifies that both the subject and the object refer to the same entity or concept, allowing for different terminologies or abbreviations to be used interchangeably in various contexts.

Predicate-is_further_proposed_to_model.label: is further proposed to model
Predicate-is_further_proposed_to_model.description: The predicate 'is further proposed to model' indicates a suggestion or recommendation that the subject has the capability or potential to represent, simulate, or analyze the object. It implies that the subject is being put forward as a suitable framework or approach for understanding or addressing the complexities of the object in question.

Predicate-evaluate_through.label: evaluate through
Predicate-evaluate_through.description: The predicate 'evaluate through' indicates a process in which the subject is assessed or analyzed by means of the object. It implies that the subject's effectiveness, performance, or quality is determined by utilizing the methodologies, techniques, or experiments represented by the object. This connection suggests that the object serves as a tool or framework for conducting the evaluation of the subject.

Predicate-for.label: for
Predicate-for.description: The predicate 'for' indicates a relationship of purpose, relevance, or applicability between the subject and the object. It connects the subject to the object by specifying the context, audience, or conditions under which the subject is relevant or intended to be used. In general, it serves to clarify the intended use or focus of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: The predicate 'evaluate' signifies the action of assessing or measuring the effectiveness, performance, or quality of the subject in relation to the object. In this context, it indicates that the subject is being analyzed or tested against the criteria or outcomes represented by the object.

Predicate-are_for.label: are for
Predicate-are_for.description: The predicate 'are for' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is designed, intended, or suitable for the context or category represented by the object.

Predicate-reveals.label: reveals
Predicate-reveals.description: The predicate 'reveals' indicates that the subject provides information or insight that makes the object known or apparent. It suggests a process of uncovering or disclosing details that were previously hidden or not fully understood, thereby enhancing the understanding of the object in relation to the subject.

Predicate-reduces.label: reduces
Predicate-reduces.description: The predicate 'reduces' indicates a relationship where the subject is capable of decreasing the magnitude, intensity, or quantity of the object. It implies a causal or functional connection in which the action or characteristic of the subject leads to a lesser state or amount of the object, suggesting an improvement or efficiency in the context of the relationship.

Predicate-improves.label: improves
Predicate-improves.description: The predicate 'improves' indicates a positive change or enhancement in the quality, performance, or effectiveness of the object as a result of the subject's influence or action. It suggests that the subject contributes to a better state or condition of the object, leading to increased efficiency, accuracy, or overall success.

Predicate-reveals_that.label: reveals that
Predicate-reveals_that.description: The predicate 'reveals that' serves to indicate a disclosure or uncovering of information or findings by the subject, which in this case is typically a study or research. It connects the subject to the object by suggesting that the subject has provided evidence or insights that clarify, explain, or demonstrate the validity or significance of the object. This predicate implies a relationship where the subject acts as a source of knowledge that enhances understanding of the object.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is a component, element, or subset of the object. It signifies that the subject contributes to or is included within the broader context or structure represented by the object, highlighting a hierarchical or associative connection between the two.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. In this context, the subject encompasses particular examples or types, while the object signifies a wider classification that includes the subject along with other related entities.
